org.fhnw.aigs.commons

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.fhnw.aigs.commons.Game

  • public abstract class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    This abstract is the base class of all games on the server side.
    Do not use this class on the clients. Instead use ClientGam. This class cannot be instantiated directly but must extend another class.
    The class supports the player with a lot of helper methods like "pickRandomPlayer".
    If the predefined behaviour does not match your game, override the methods involved. The method "hasEnoughParticipants" for example can differ among games, even though in most cases the basic implementation given in this class will suffice.
    VERY Important: Only use an empty constructor! The class will be automatically loaded. The empty constructor of the inherited class must call Game's constructor. Example:
    super("TicTacToe", 2, 2);
    v1.0 Initial release
    v1.1 Private game property, version property and toString method added
    Version:
    v1.1 (Raphael Stoeckli, 21.10.2014)
    Author:
    Matthias St√∂ckli (v1.0)

    • Field Detail

      • currentHighestId

        public static volatile long currentHighestId
        The currently highest game id. This variable is used to generate new game IDs.

      • minNumberOfPlayers

        protected final int minNumberOfPlayers
        Minimum number of players.

      • gameName

        protected final java.lang.String gameName
        Name of the game. The name must match the name of the project/folder etc. The game name must not be changed!

      • gameMode

        protected GameMode gameMode
        The game mode helps controlling the game flow. if the game mode "SinglePlayer" is selected, it is not possible to use the method "startGameWith" on the client side.

      • id

        protected long id
        The game's unique id. It is based on "idCounter".

      • players

        protected java.util.ArrayList<Player> players
        List of all players in the current game.

      • currentPlayer

        private Player currentPlayer
        The player whose turn it is, i.e. the active player who is allowed to move his or her token etc.

      • aiPlayer

        protected Player aiPlayer
        The AI is represented as an ordinary player.

      • partyName

        protected java.lang.String partyName
        Name of the party, e.g. "pascal04". This can be used to make sure that one can join a game with a specific group of people.

      • gameEnded

        protected boolean gameEnded
        Indicates whether the game is still running or not

      • privateGame

        protected boolean privateGame
        Indicates whether the game is private or public

      • versionString

        protected java.lang.String versionString
        Indicates a (optional) version number of the game. Use this for better version control of games on the server

    • Constructor Detail

      • Game

        public Game(java.lang.String gameName,
            int minNumberOfPlayers)
        Game is abstract, therefore it is not possible to create instances without inheriting from the class. Use this and only this constructor when defining a new class inheriting from Game.
        Parameters:
        gameName - The name of the game.
        minNumberOfPlayers - The minimum required number of players.

        Parameters:
        gameName - The name of the game.
        minNumberOfPlayers - The minimum required number of players.
        version - The version of the game

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public abstract void initialize()
        This is the first method that will be called after the game has been set up. It can serve as some sort of substitute for a constructor. Here all preparations can be made, e.g. setting up the board, distributing tokens etc.

      • startGame

        public void startGame()
        This method starts the game. It generates GameStartMessage based on the current game. This message will be sent to all players. They will be informed about the game's start and the starting player. Usually this method is called at the end of the initialize() method after everything has been set up.
        Please note: If your minNumberOfPlayers is 1 or 0 (which is actually impossible) then the currentPlayer will automatically be set to the only player in game.

      • processGameLogic

        public abstract void processGameLogic(Message message,
                                      Player sendingPlayer)
        This method is the core of every game on the server side. Due to the abstract nature, it must be implemented by every Game. The method is responsible for the the processing of incoming messages. It is intended to work in a very similar way to the processGameLogic method of the client side.
        ProcessGameLogic() will be called as soon as a non system message (e.g. JoinMessage or similar) arrives. The ServerMessageBroker on the server side will forward the class to this method. In this method it will then be interpreted and the results will change the game accordingly, e.g. move player's tokens etc. The message must first be checked for the type. This can be done in the following way:
        if(message instanceof [[YourMessageClass]])
        Where [[YourMessageClass]] is the name of the message class, e.g. FieldClickMessage. Then the message can be explicitly cast to the desired type:
        FieldClickMessage fieldClickMessage = (FieldClickMessage)message;
        In the end of every processGameLogic method a call to passTurnToNextPlayer() or similar should be made in order to pass the turn to the next player.
        Parameters:
        message - The message passed from ServerMessageBroker.
        sendingPlayer - The player who sent the message.

      • checkForWinningCondition

        public abstract void checkForWinningCondition()
        This method will be called automatically after the processGameLogic(org.fhnw.aigs.commons.communication.Message, org.fhnw.aigs.commons.Player) method finished. It is used to determine whether a game ends or not. It is up to the user to define what will happen. In most cases a GameEndsMessage should be sent to all clients in order to inform them that the game is over. The clients' reactions should reflect this fact and they should shut down.

      • hasEnoughParticipants

        public boolean hasEnoughParticipants()
        Checks whether the game already has enough participants to start the game. It will start as soon as the minimum amount of players is reached. In some cases, this method will not reflect the needs of the players, e.g. when there are certain constraints. In this case, it is best to override the method. It will be automatically called after a new player joins the game in the GameManager.joinGame} on the server side.
        Returns:
        True if the game has enough participants, false if not.

      • passTurnToNextPlayer

        public void passTurnToNextPlayer()
        Passes the turn to the next player in the queue based on the id. The id is based on the index of the player inside the players collection. If it is player 1's turn, the player 2 will be next, if the player 2 is the last player, the next player will be player 1 etc. After the current player was set, a "PlayerChangedMessage" is sent to all clients. It is up to them to react accordingly.

      • sendMessageToAllPlayers

        public void sendMessageToAllPlayers(Message message)
        Sends a message to all players in the current game.
        The message will not be sent to players with the Player.isAi flag.
        Parameters:
        message - The message to be sent.

      • sendMessageToPlayer

        public void sendMessageToPlayer(Message message,
                                Player player)
        Sends a message to a single player. The message will not be sent to players with the Player.isAi flag.
        Parameters:
        message - The message to be sent.
        player - The player who will receive the message.

      • sendMessageToCurrentPlayer

        public void sendMessageToCurrentPlayer(Message message)
        Sends a message to the current player. The message will not be sent to players with the Player.isAi flag.
        Parameters:
        message - The message to be sent.
